|cpu1chip1 = MediaTek;MT7620N; |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 24KEc |cpu1_type_rev = <!-- CPU1 type Revision, Leave blank for unknown --> |cpu1spd = 580 <!-- 580 / 600 MHz --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),SPI NOR,NAND,Compact Flash, --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |flash1size = 16 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 64 |ram1chip = Macronix;MX25L12805D; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |oui = <!-- Wireless OUI -->
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = U-Boot;1.1.3;; |stockos = Linux;3.14.18;;

|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->

|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = <!-- FCCID approval date --> |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B01CTNN07K |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== ===Kimax U25AWF=== There is three brend name of this device '''Kimax/Mixxar/[http://blueendless.en.alibaba.com/product/60142658344-210855055/Blueendless_BS_U25WF_hard_disk_case_with_wifi_hdd_enclosure_2_5_inch.html Blueendless]''' :There is not official site of it. Kimax U25AWF is a HDD Enclosure with Wi-Fi/Eth conection and battery. :It has 1x USB 2.0 and 1x USB 3.0 OTG/Charge.
===Modes=== It has three modes :1. HDD Enclosure with USB 2.0 HUB :2. NAS ::2a. Power supply from battery ::2b. Power supply from USB 3.0 port :3. Power bank
==Links of Interest== ===Vendor links=== *[http://www.aliexpress.com/item/high-quality-Plastic-usb-3-0-2-5-inch-to-sata-power-bank-4000mh-external-hard/32450085012.html Kimax U25AWF on '''AliExpress'''] (currently selling for ~$45)
==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/blueendless/blueendless_u25awf |wikipage = |forumpage = https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=56056 |forumpage2 = https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=61854 |forumpage3 = |github = |target = ramips |subtarget = mt7620 |arch = mipsel_24kc |support_started_version = 18.06.0 |current_supported_version = <!-- auto --> |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} Please insert instructions here
====OEM Firmware==== It is OpenWRT with changed WebUI (system version 1.1.6). :There is not Telnet/SHH.
There is patch supporting all option of this device. :Checked for Chaos Calmer. All work *[http://rghost.net/download/8rHRdG6rr/cd801c2c0cbcf87a1da4682372a833091cd65fe9/U25AWF.patch Kimax U25AWF Patch] ==Upgrading== ====Upgrading Firmware==== It can be done with OEM WebUI.
====Upgrading Bootloader==== You can upgrade bootloader from u-boot menu or using programmer.
==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== Board don`t have pins for serial connection. But you can solder three wires :(2 micro pad tx, rx and gnd get at any place where you want). Serial port settings is 57600 8n1 for u-boot and 9600 8n1 :(was found out by "logic analyzer") for firmware :(settings are changed from start of uploading firmware)
[[Category:English Documentation]]
